A major decline in international travelers due to #COVID19 could cause a dramatically large effect on the trade and current account balances of small, tourism-dependent countries. Read more on #IMFblog. https://t.co/rgGBqyAchV

All countries should ensure debt remains sustainable, including through revenue-raising and cuts to wasteful spending, and those in debt distress should restructure to free up resources to fight the crisis. Read @GitaGopinath’s op-ed https://t.co/zBrUlCQwXn

In a new @FT op-ed, @GitaGopinath says that with interest rates below 1% in 60% of the global economy, the world is in a liquidity trap. Monetary policy has limited impact. Fiscal policy must now play a leading role in the recovery.
https://t.co/zBrUlCQwXn

Government budget balances are expected to improve in 2021 in many #G20 nations as #COVID19 relief winds down. Yet unemployment remains high and countries will need to keep spending wisely to counter an ongoing crisis. Read the latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/xROjrT6JnS
